Container.Name: plex-releases-summary
Container.Overview: A lightweight Docker container that fetches recently added media from your Plex server via Tautulli and sends summaries to Discord. Configuration is managed via config.yml file for easy editing. Supports scheduled execution with CRON timing or one-shot mode. IMPORTANT: Before starting, you must create config.yml in your appdata folder. Download config.yml.example from GitHub, copy it to /mnt/user/appdata/plex-releases-summary/config.yml, and edit with your settings.
Container.Requires: Requires: 1. Tautulli installed and accessible 2. config.yml file in appdata folder (download config.yml.example from GitHub: https://github.com/thomas-lg/plex-releases-summary/blob/main/configs/config.yml.example) 3. Correct Docker network to communicate with Tautulli Setup: Create /mnt/user/appdata/plex-releases-summary/config.yml before starting container.

Config.Name: AppData Config Path
Config.Description: Path to store config.yml file. You must create config.yml here before starting the container. Download config.yml.example from the GitHub repository and customize it.

Config.Name: Tautulli API Key
Config.Description: (OPTIONAL) Tautulli API key for interpolation in config.yml. You can either: 1) Set this variable and use ${TAUTULLI_API_KEY} in config.yml, OR 2) Hardcode the API key directly in config.yml. Find API key in: Tautulli Settings > Web Interface > API

Config.Name: Discord Webhook URL
Config.Description: (OPTIONAL) Discord webhook URL for interpolation in config.yml. You can either: 1) Set this variable and use ${DISCORD_WEBHOOK_URL} in config.yml, OR 2) Hardcode the URL directly in config.yml, OR 3) Leave empty to disable Discord. To get webhook: Discord Server Settings > Integrations > Webhooks > New Webhook

Config.Name: CRON Schedule
Config.Description: CRON schedule for automatic execution (e.g., '0 16 * * SUN' for every Sunday at 4 PM). Required for scheduled mode (default). Set RUN_ONCE=true to use one-shot mode instead.

Config.Name: Run Once
Config.Description: Set to 'true' for one-shot execution (runs once and exits). Leave empty for scheduled mode.
